result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
FOTHWITH
--On Count #1 The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 20 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  12  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  8 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith and is ordered consecutive to any other sentence in being.

--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Credit Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

superMiscConds.notes: --  Restitution for funeral expenses in the amount of $1439.00 payable to Mr. and Mrs. Murrenus.

--  Subpoena fees and other recoverable costs of prosecution - $472.00
--  Costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge.

--  No possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
 
--  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
 
--  No contact with known drug offenders except in treatment and as allowed by the Agent.

--  Absolute sobriety.
 
--  Take all prescription medications only as prescribed. 
 . 
--  Any other treatment, counseling, therapy and compliance with recommendation. 
 
 --If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson County Sheriff
--  AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other Sentence in being

FORTHWITH
--In Count #2 The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  5  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith and concurrent

--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Credit Program.
Concurrent with:

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:43pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Robert D Smith in court with attorney Syovata Kanini Edari.  Defendant Robert D Smith in custody.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling and procedural issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Documents submitted by the State:
State's Exh. #1 - Statement of Funeral Expenses
State's Exh. #2 - Victim Impact Statement
Document submitted by the Defense:
Written statement of 3rd party. 

No factual corrections to the PSI requested by the State. 
Two factual corrections to the PSI requested by the Defense and acknowledged by the Court.  The name of the defendant's child listed on pg# 2 is corrected and regarding the timeline regarding bond in this case and a Waukesha County case listed on pg #7. 

Recommendations presented by ADA Hall.
Statement presented by Ms. Norton. 

Recommendations presented by Atty. Edari.
Recess 2:39pm; Recalled 3:08pm
Additional arguments presented by Atty. Edari.
Response presented by ADA Hall.
Statement presented by Ms. A. Smith, Mr. Smith, Ms. Neff and Ms. F.Smith.
Statement presented by the defendant. 

In Count #1 The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 20 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  12  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  8 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith and is ordered consecutive to any other sentence in being. 

In Count #2 The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  5  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith and concurrent. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
The Court finds the the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
The Court finds the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Credit Program.

The Court gives 141 days credit for time already served.  

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--  Restitution for funeral expenses in the amount of $1439.00 payable to Mr. and Mrs. Murrenus.
--  Subpoena fees and other recoverable costs of prosecution - $472.00
--  Costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge.
--  AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations.
--  Absolute sobriety.
--  No possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
--  Take all prescription medications only as prescribed. 
--  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--  Any other treatment, counseling, therapy and compliance with recommendation. 
--  No contact with known drug offenders except in treatment and as allowed by the Agent. 

Felony Firearm prohibition/warnings given
Voting ineligibility form given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

The Court directs Atty. Edari to ensure that the email she referred to during the hearing is forwarded to the Clerk for the file.  
Recess 4:02pm

[Clerk's note - email received by clerk post hearing and copied provides a copy to both counsel.]
Excerpt of Testimony of James Oehlrich--March 30, 2016
Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Continue Sentencing
from ADA Hall re: Defendant's Drug Screen
of the Preliminary Hearing held on February 13, 2015 before the Honorable Randy R Koschnick
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Objection to Substantial Factor Test Contained in Reckless Homicide Instruction

Case called at 8:21 am [Clerk SH] (Day 4) Jury Bailiff: D. Griffee
Defendant Robert D Smith in court with Attorney Syovata Kanini Edari and Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Ksicinski submits Defense Objection to Substantial Factor Test Contained in Reckless Homicide Instruction
Atty Edari informs the Court that they still intend to call defense witness; ADA Hall informs the Court that it will depend on what the witnesses testify to, but is unlikely will have rebuttal testimony
Court informs parties that this is not the final jury instruction conference, that will be held later today. Counsel request to address the Defense objections before review of any instructions; Court agrees.
Arguments presented re: reckless homicide instruction-Court finds that Borage is interpreting a Federal Court is interpreting Federal Statute and will rely on State Case Below, recommended by Miss Hall. 
Arguments presented re: police investigation-Court presents basis and finds that instruction shall be included as modified by Court/Counsel
Court suspends discussions on jury instructions as all jurors are now present and informs parties that they will take up all remaining issues during instruction conference - Jury Enters: 9:01 am 
Court informs jurors that the evidence has been reopened upon request of the defense and that they have been allowed to present one more witness
ADA Hall informs the Court that there is a defense witness in the gallery, have no objection to him remaining in gallery as do not believe he will testify again in trial

Thomas Fischer--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Ksicinski
--Defendant Exh#23
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--redirect exam by Atty Ksicinski
--recross exam by ADA Hall
Defense Rests. Evidence Closed 9:48 am - Jury Exits: 9:49 am 
Jury Instruction Conference (off record: 9:53 - 9:55; 10:06 - 10:07; 10:08 - 10:11; 10:12 - 10:21; 10:22 am)
ADA Hall requests 15 minutes before continuing with closings
Recess: 10:24 am Reconvene: 10:44 am 
Court confirms with Clerk that the final jury instructions and verdict forms have been distributed to counsel; Jury Enters: 10:46 am

Closing arguments given by ADA Hall (10:46 - 11:12 am)
Closing arguments given by Atty Edari (11:12 - 11:49 am)
Atty Edari requests the Court for brief recess - Recess: 11:49 am - Jury Exits: Reconvene: 12:00 pm - Jury Enters
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA Hall (12:00 - 12:28 pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (12:28 - 12:47 pm)
Deputy Dennis Griffee is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate juror is selected through the tumbler system; Juror #61 is excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 12:48 pm
Counsel agree that Exhibits#1 - #4, #6, #8-#20, #22 & 23 may be provided to the jury for use during deliberations; Exh#12 is provided as "clean copy" - ADA Hall makes copy of exhibit 
that will not include hightlights and "marked up" version to provide to jury.
Recess: 12:54 pm  3:48 pm: Jury returns with its Verdict

The Jury finds Mr. Smith Guilty of Count #1, First Degree Reckless Homicide
The Jury finds Mr. Smith Guilty of Count #2, Manufacture/Deliver Heroin
The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written verdict form. Jury exits: 3:52 pm 
ADA Hall orally motions for judgment on verdicts; Atty Edari orally motions for judgment not withstanding verdict
On Count #1, The Court receives the Verdict, finds Mr. Smith guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered
On Count #2, The Court receives the Verdict, finds Mr. Smith guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered
ADA Hall orally motions to revoke bond; Arguments presented by Atty Edari; Court presents basis, revokes bond
Atty Edari requests sentencing in approximately 60 days; ADA Hall requests PSI and requests testing upon entry into the jail due to suspicion of abuse or misuse of prescription medication
Court grants request of the State for drug testing upon entry into the jail. Court grants PSI, to be completed within the next 60 days, with sentencing in approximately 90 days.
Court remands custody of the Defendant to the Sheriff
Recess: 3:58 pm 

NEXT: (1) PSI (2) State to coordinate with Defense Counsel & contact Court's JA for scheduling of sentencing hearing on 4/1/16 (2.5 hours) - Send notices

Defendant Robert D Smith in court with Attorney Syovata Kanini Edari and Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court informs parties that Clerk informed the Court that the defense was withdrawing objection regarding field testing
Atty Ksicinski confirms that the defense objection regarding the field testing objection has been withdrawn, cites 60wi2.267

Atty Edari informs the Court that they have 3 witnesses present and ready to go this morning, others are coming this afternoon; possible could be done today.

Arguments by Counsel; Court questions Detective Garcia regarding investigation into the witness intimidation allegations raised during this trial
Court directs individuals to report actions to the Jefferson Count Sheriff's Office and Detective Sergeant Hunter
Court finds It does not have authority to exclude individual as being requested by the defense

Court reviews again with Mr. Smith his right to/not to testify. Mr. Smith informs the Court that he will testify. Counsel confirm that they have had enough time to consult with Mr. Smith. 
Court finds that Mr. Smith's decision to testify is being made freely, voluntarily and intelligently. 
Court informs Counsel that It has requested an extra bailiff - Jury enters: 10:57 am

--direct exam by Atty Edari

ADA Hall reads message - Atty Edari requests time to meet with witness; Court informs parties It will reconvene in 10 minutes.

Court admonishes Mr. Smith regarding following the Court's direction regarding breaks - Jury Enters: 1:09 pm

Court's attention that Mr. Jacque was in the courtroom for at least 15 - 20 minutes this morning during 
Detective Garcia's testimony; inquires of counsel regarding giving the court's instruction re: sequestration
Atty Edari informs the Court that Miss Murrenus & analyst will be defense lat witnesses
Recess: 2:16 pm Reconvene: 2:35 pm - Jury Enters
Court informs parties that the Clerk informed him that Miss Shannon Murrenus was also in the Courtroom
this morning during Detective Garcia's testimony this morning. Atty Edari informs the Court that as soon as she 
did notice Miss Murrenus in the courtroom, she did remove her from the courtroom and did remind her of the sequestration order
Appeared Miss Murrenus did not understand the order, knew she could not discuss the case, but did not believe she could not 
be in the courtroom.
Atty Ksicinski informs the Court that they would like to recall Mr. Jacque

Christopher Jacque--sworn & testfies
--direct exam by Atty Ksicinski
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--Jury Exits: 2:42 pm - Jury Enters: 2:46 pm 
--juror question (marked as Court Exh#4) not asked of witness, marked for identification only

Shannon Murrenus--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Edari
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--redirect exam by Atty Edari
off-record: 3:24 - 3:26 pm 

James Oehldrich--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Edari
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--redirect exam by Atty Edari
--recross exam by ADA Hall
--juror question (marked as Court Exh#5) asked of witness by the Court

Defense Rests: 4:45 pm ADA Hall informs the Court that they do not intend to 
offer rebuttal evidence. Evidence Closed: 4:45 pm 
Court instructs the jury reagrding tomorrow's procedure - Jury Exits: 4:47 pm
Counsel confirm that they have received the draft packet of Jury instructions from the Judicial Assistant; Court informs parties that they will not begin instructions this evening by will cover in conference tomorrow beginning at 8:15 am.
Atty Ksicinski informs the Court that they have made an error regarding witnesses, do have another witnesses for case in chief, Thomas Fischer; Atty Edari thought he would be a rebuttal witness, ADA Hall was informed of witness a few days ago and requests to reopen evidence. ADA Hall informs the Court that she was informed that Mr. Fischer was a rebuttal witness, objects to witness testimony, presents basis, including discovery violation and relevance objection.
Atty Ksicinski presents offer of proof re: Mr. Fischer's testimony regarding police investigations - arguments presented. Court finds witness testimony is relevant. 
Arguments presented by Counsel re: discovery violation - Court finds there has been a discovery violation under 971.23(2m) and that Mr. Fischer's name should have been filed with the State 7 days prior to trial
Atty Edari presents arguments relating to good cause finding; Atty Ksicinski presents arguments; Arguments by ADA Hall - Court presents basis, including ineffective assistance of counsel claims and find good cause for failure to comply with the statutory requirement and allows Defense witness to testify. If after the Defense witness testifies, the State needs a continuance, the Court will entertain that request.
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates that she would prefer to begin working on jury instructions at 8:15 am, rather than taking all that time to research defense witness
Recess: 5:22 pm 

***MINUTES NOT COMPLETE****

Atty Edari informs the Court that Witness Trupke may be likely to plead the fifth; Court informs parties that It must have this conversation with witness outside presence of the jury, so as soon as counsel knows for sure this will be the case, should let the court know. Court/Counsel further discuss rebuttal witnesses &

Case called at 8:39 am [Clerk SH] (Day 1) Jury Bailiff: D. Griffee
Defendant Robert D Smith in court with Attorney Syovata Kanini Edari and Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court addresses procedural matters related to trial: 
--Atty Edari submits order to produce; Court endorses
--Atty Ksicinski requests to step out for brief time to call in to Milwaukee County for preliminary hearing; Court grants
--Atty Ksicinski addresses format of text messages provided to parties today; arguments by Counsel
--Atty Edari requests to now addresses text messages; Court provides guidelines; arguments by Counsel-Court finds It has already made prior ruling and will not revisit morning of trial

On Defense Motions in Limine:
#4-State does not object as long as it is on the record; Court explains waiver of public trial for Mr. Smith. Mr. Smith confirms waiver of public trial for this portion of trial.
#11-Atty Edari has no objection to photos mentioned by State
#14-Atty Edari has no issue with address of one witness being withheld
#22-Parties agree to confer off-record
#19-Hearsay to be addressed during trial
Atty Edari requests witness sequestration; Court grants with the exception of Detective Garcia; Court directs Counsel

Case recalled at 1:54 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert D Smith in court with Attorney Syovata Kanini Edari and Attorney Paul Ksicinski. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Edari informs the Court that Mr. Smith got lost on the way to Court today, missed exit and ended up in Fort Atkinson and that during the trial Mr. Smith does have someone local that he can stay with so he will not be late
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court presents basis and requires a $1250 cash bond, ($500 already posted) with conditions:
